common_issues.title: Vague Responses from Chat Assistant
common_issues.description: Users report the chat assistant provides unhelpful responses like "I'll get back to you."  This occurs after approximately 20 interactions and across different prompts.  The issue lacks clear reproduction steps.  No solutions have been identified.

related_issues.title: Response "I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible"
related_issues.text:
Response "I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible"
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**The Bug**
The chat assistant will respond claiming that it's working on a solution and will get back to you at a later date. 

**Expected Behaviour**
Get an actionable response with some suggested action/code.

**Details**
Most recent example of this kind of response ("_" is not part of the response just a redaction):

> "I'll carefully examine the data flow related to _, _, _, _, and _  to see if any inconsistencies could lead to bugs. Please give me a few minutes to review the code thoroughly with this specific focus in mind. I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible."

This has happened in three different conversations. I first noticed the behaviour this month, so not before updates preceding March. I promise I'm not trying to be lazy on this one, it's difficult to offer reproduction steps.

I use Claude 3.5 more than any option regularly.

The last conversation where this happened:

- I loaded 15 files into the context menu
- I sent 22 requests (and received 22 responses where it happened on the 22nd response)

I'll update this issue if there's anything I can do to make the reproduction more narrow.
## Summary of Github Issue Conversation:

**Key Point:** User `seantiz` reports a bug where no files are loaded into the context after sending 11 requests and receiving 11 responses.

**Problem Identified:** The files sent through the API are not loading into the context, causing the requests to fail.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**
* User `seantiz` could not identify the specific cause of the bug.
* The support bot suggests a related issue and resources for documentation and troubleshooting. 

**Current Status/Outcome:**
* The issue remains unresolved.
* The support team hasn't provided further updates.

**Additional Notes:**
* The provided information is limited. 
* Further investigation is needed to determine the cause of the bug and potential solutions.

related_issues.title: "Secret Message" Example doesn't work properly
related_issues.text:
"Secret Message" Example doesn't work properly
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When using LTM-2 to test the secret message example:
https://pieces.app/magic-moments/ltm

I got a strange response from the LLM:
Claude 3.5:
First Try:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1962a3e4-8b02-4d3f-bc8c-4bdd72c80aa6)
2. try: (waited longer on the website)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cd71c5c1-d5d5-4449-acd5-e070fb244fa9)

Gemini 2.0 Flash did fail completely:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/50735f7a-28a1-4563-b490-e10c271eca23)
## Conversation Summary:

**Key Points:**

* Multiple users reported seeing a "Basic mode due to device constraints" message in the menu bar.
* The issue appears to be related to the Long Term Memory (LTM) engine not working properly on certain M3 Macs.
* The secret message feature is also not functioning as expected on these devices.
* Workstream activity is not visible and the LTM engine is not updating regularly.
* The issue is not documented and users are confused about the meaning of "Basic mode".

**Problems Identified:**

* LTM engine functionality is limited on M3 Macs.
* Secret message feature not working on M3 Macs.
* Workstream activity not visible.
* LTM engine updates not happening.
* Lack of documentation about "Basic mode".

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Restarting piecesOS can temporarily resolve the issue.
* Closing and re-opening piecesOS may also help.
* A fix will be implemented in the next version of piecesOS.
* Mark-at-pieces offered to elaborate on the meaning of "Basic mode".

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is acknowledged and a fix is planned for the next piecesOS version.
* Users can temporarily resolve the issue by restarting or closing and re-opening piecesOS.
* The meaning of "Basic mode" needs further clarification.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user bartonfriedland also experienced an issue with "Unknown Origin" in the telemetry browser, which may be related to a previous installation of piecesOS.
* There seems to be some confusion about the availability of the "Workstream Activity" feature in the Mac OS app.

## Summary:

This issue highlights a bug in piecesOS that affects the functionality of the LTM engine on M3 Macs. Users are experiencing problems with secret messages, workstream activity visibility, and LTM engine updates. A fix is planned for the next version of piecesOS, but users can temporarily resolve the issue by restarting or closing and re-opening piecesOS.

## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Issue:** Users were encountering an error message stating "show error" when attempting to send messages on the desktop app. 

**Key Points:**

* The issue was reported by multiple users on different platforms (Mac, Windows).
* The error occurred after sending the first message in a new chat.
* Users were unable to send further messages.

**Proposed/Implemented Solutions:**

* The Pieces support bot automatically routed the issue to the relevant team.
* The Pieces team identified the problem and deployed a patch release to resolve the error.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue has been fixed with the release of a patch.
* Users confirmed that the problem is resolved.

**Additional Notes:** 

* The conversation highlights the importance of user feedback in identifying and addressing issues.
* The Pieces team responded promptly and effectively to resolve the problem.

common_issues.title: Pieces extension conflicts and UI issues
common_issues.description: Users report conflicts between Pieces extension for Visual Studio and SQL Server Object Explorer, causing difficulties editing database fields.  Suggested workarounds include disabling the extension or specific features. Other UI issues involve cursor malfunction after closing tool windows and embed button conflicts on websites, addressed by temporary disabling or blacklisting.

related_issues.title: Pieces Visual Studio 2022 extension conflict with SQL Server Object Explorer
related_issues.text:
Pieces Visual Studio 2022 extension conflict with SQL Server Object Explorer
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Visual Studio

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

With Pieces Extension installed in Visual studio 2022, SQL database field is not editable (not clickable?)

Reproduce: 
- Connect to any SQL server with some table, choose a table and right click -> View Data
- Try edit the database's table field (the field will be unable to focus, so unable to edit)

* SQL database is editable again after disable pieces extension and restart VS.
* Try turn off everything in the extension's UserPreference did not work.
* While you can not edit a field, but delete a row is possible (so maybe some UI conflict?)

Here are some picture

Without the extension: the edit cursor shown up when click on field
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c45dbafe-29c7-4acd-9827-b34cd0cd76f7)

With the extension: the edit cursor did not show up. Clicking just selected the field.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8f430ff6-18f8-41fe-a58e-42ebbeec3be2)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: "Cursor stuck in cell after removing Tool Window"

**Key Points Raised:**

* User (@hikineet98) reported an issue where the cursor gets stuck in a cell after removing the Tool Window.
* The issue is reproducible on the developer's end.
* The cause of the issue is unclear.

**Problems Identified:**

* The user cannot edit other cells after removing the Tool Window.
* The cause of the issue is unknown, making it difficult to resolve.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The developer has not yet identified a solution for this issue.
* They are investigating the cause of the issue and potential solutions.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is still under investigation.
* The developer will provide an update as soon as they have more information.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue appears to be related to a conflict between the Tool Window and the Pieces for Visual Studio plugin.
* The developer is investigating this possibility.

I hope this summary is concise and helpful! Please let me know if you have any further questions.

* User luceat-lux-vestra reported an issue where embed buttons were causing problems on a specific website.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Installation and Update Issues
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS installation ignoring default system app locations and update failures. Suggested solutions include checking for App Installer updates on Windows and configuring antivirus software to allow Pieces OS processes.

related_issues.title: Installation doesn't follow the System Apps default location
related_issues.text:
Installation doesn't follow the System Apps default location
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

There's no opportunity for the User to choose where the Pieces OS is installed or where any data that's collected is stored. From Windows 10 onwards there is a system feature to set where new content is to be stored by default. This is in Settings/System/Storage.

You can set where new Apps will be installed, new documents are stored, Music, etc.

Once this is set I would expect a current application to follow the default installation setting rather than hardcode it for the Boot drive.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User bpluly created an issue regarding Pieces OS update failure.
* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the relevant team member.
* The user might find related issues helpful, including ones related to update failures and inability to launch PiecesOS.
* The user is directed to helpful resources: existing issues, documentation, and the YouTube channel.

**Problems Identified:**

* The user experienced an issue with Pieces OS update failure.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Automated triage and routing to the relevant team member.
* Suggestion of related issues and helpful resources.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The user's issue is being addressed by the Pieces team.
* The user can check related issues and resources for further information.
* The outcome of the issue is currently unknown.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS Update fails
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS Update fails
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The notification popped up saying an update was available so I clicked Update and a few seconds later got this message box:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b14dc8ab-632a-4095-b45b-7bbaba3c70ce)

This is on a very fresh Windows 11 installation.
## GitHub Issue Summary: PiecesOS launch error

**Key points:**

* User (@ThatRendle) is experiencing an error launching PiecesOS on Windows.
* User is likely experiencing a bug on Windows with the App Installer technology.
* Another user (@bejokun) reports the same issue and their antivirus software (Kaspersky) is detecting PiecesOS as a Trojan.

**Problems identified:**

* PiecesOS fails to launch.
* Antivirus software may flag PiecesOS as a threat.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Update App Installer through the Microsoft Store.
* Configure Kaspersky to allow PiecesOS processes.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue with App Installer might be resolved by updating it.
* Kaspersky users might need to configure their antivirus to allow PiecesOS.
* It is unclear if the issue is fully resolved for all users.

**Additional notes:**

* The issue appears to be specific to Windows.
* Other users have reported similar issues in the past.
* Resources are provided for further assistance.

I hope this summary is concise and informative. Please let me know if you have any questions.

Suggested solutions involve updating the App Installer, configuring antivirus settings, and checking related issues for potential workarounds.

related_issues.title: Personal Domain backup
related_issues.text:
Personal Domain backup
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I want to sync this PC to another PC，but i cann't backup the lastest data.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/bfb4fb14-5e7f-45c7-828f-5f77f550453a)

this is another PC

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3c2d880e-a1b2-40c1-82b1-9935bffbf8fb)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* Laborer123 is having trouble changing their personal domain and restoring their backup.
* They are attempting to copy data from com.pieces.os com.pieces.pfd to another PC.
* They have an existing personal domain which they want to use for backup and restore.

**Problems:**

* Laborer123 is unable to register a personal domain.
* They are unable to restore their backup from the cloud.
* They are unsure how to create a new personal domain for backup.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces suggests trying to register a new personal domain to ensure the functionality.
* They also suggest clicking the refresh icon to initiate a backup restore, which should overwrite local data.
* They offer further assistance if the user continues to face issues.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Laborer123 has confirmed that they are unable to directly back up their existing personal domain and create a new one.
* Mark-at-pieces has not yet responded to their latest comment.

**Note:** The conversation is ongoing, and the current outcome may change.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Extension Conflicts and Errors

Solutions included blacklisting problematic sites, suppressing errors in the extension, and updating to the latest version. The Pieces team actively worked with users to diagnose and resolve these issues.

related_issues.title: Chrome Extension Fills Developer Console with Errors
related_issues.text: Chrome Extension Fills Developer Console with Errors ### Software Web Extension ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.0.3 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. It appears the browser extension is sniffing a bunch of local ports - starting with 1000. This is a bit concerning, and a little invasive, but I do have the Pieces OS running, and it does finally get a response at a high port. This fills my devtools console tab, degrading my development experience by clouding errors I'm looking for in my own app. For a product designed to enhance my development experience I'm marking this as a bug. ## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary **Key Points:** * Pieces OS extension for Chrome was making network calls to unexpected ports, causing errors in the browser's dev console. * This was due to changes in Pieces OS that made it run on a user-defined port. * Although the calls were harmless, they caused visual clutter and interfered with debugging for users. **Problems Identified:** * Unnecessary network calls flooded the dev console with errors. * These errors made it difficult for users to distinguish real errors from false positives. **Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** * The developer investigated the issue and identified a potential Chrome bug. * While waiting for a potential Chrome fix, the developer implemented a workaround in the Pieces OS extension to suppress the errors. * They also suggested users could hide network messages in the dev console settings, but acknowledged this might not be a feasible solution for everyone. **Current Status/Outcome:** * The issue was fixed in a recent update to the Pieces OS web extension (version 4.0.4). * Users are encouraged to update their extension to avoid the unnecessary errors. **Additional Notes:** * The developer was responsive and addressed the user's concerns promptly. * They provided a clear explanation of the problem and the proposed solutions. * The user expressed appreciation for the developer's efforts and commitment to resolving the issue.

related_issues.title: pieces desktop and its extension not working
related_issues.text:
pieces desktop and its extension not working
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS, Web Extension, VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

latest

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

the pieces os is working but the desktop app is saying it is not working and launch pieces os but when I click pieces od it take forever and still does not start, please fix this issue
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* User `satyam-acharya15462` is experiencing issues with the desktop application, reporting that it's not working.

**Problems Identified:**

* The specific nature of the problem is unclear, as the user hasn't provided details like screenshots or videos.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* `mark-at-pieces` suggests real-time communication to diagnose the issue and offers a calendar link for scheduling.
* `rutvik-at-pieces` inquires if the issues have been resolved with the latest app and plugin builds.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* It is unclear if the user responded to either comment or confirmed if the issue has been resolved. 

**Missing Information:**

* Details about the specific problem the user is facing.
* User's confirmation regarding the issue resolution. 

**Recommendation:**

* Encourage the user to provide more details about the issue and respond to the proposed solutions for further assistance.

recommendations: **Address Common Issues:** Prioritize resolving the top three common issues: vague chat assistant responses, extension conflicts and UI issues, and Pieces OS installation/update problems.

**Improve Chat Assistant:** Investigate and address the root cause of vague responses from the chat assistant, particularly after multiple interactions. Provide clearer guidance and solutions instead of generic replies.

**Enhance Extension Compatibility:** Focus on resolving conflicts between the Pieces extension and other software, such as Visual Studio and SQL Server Object Explorer. Ensure seamless integration and functionality.

**Streamline Installation and Updates:** Simplify the Pieces OS installation process and make it easier for users to update the software. Address issues related to default installation locations and antivirus conflicts.
**Provide Clearer Documentation:** Create comprehensive documentation and FAQs that address common issues, including installation problems, extension conflicts, and chat assistant troubleshooting.
**Gather Detailed User Feedback:** Encourage users to provide specific details and reproduction steps when reporting issues. This will help in faster diagnosis and resolution.
**Proactive Communication:** Keep users informed about the status of reported issues, planned updates, and bug fixes. Regular communication can improve user satisfaction and manage expectations.
**Prioritize Active Tickets:** Focus on resolving the most active support tickets with high activity levels, as they indicate issues affecting multiple users or requiring urgent attention.

**Monitor Antivirus Compatibility:** Stay updated on antivirus software updates and proactively address any compatibility issues with Pieces OS. Collaborate with antivirus vendors to prevent false positives.

**Continuous Improvement:** Regularly analyze support data, identify trends, and implement improvements to support processes, documentation, and software functionality based on user feedback and common issues.
